description:
Line of Service

Internal Firm Services

Industry/Sector

Not Applicable

Specialism

IFS - Clients & Markets

Management Level

Senior Associate

Job Description & Summary

A career in Sales and Marketing, within Internal Firm Services, will provide you with the opportunity to focus on positioning a distinctive PwC brand in the marketplace and drive long term revenue growth for the Firm. You’ll focus on designing, developing, and implementing communication programmes and media events to promote and sell the PwC’s brand and services as well as contribute to and evaluating our pricing strategies in the marketplace.

Our team is a client focused group that is responsible for positioning the PwC brand and driving long term growth. You’ll work with sales and marketing teams to drive consistency in executing our client relationship, and business development strategy, as well as driving our sales framework to help deliver value on key business initiatives.

In order to deliver a first-class service to our clients, we need a first-class Account Driver. Account driver will be a member of the Clients & Market team – Internal Firm Services (IFS), which is a network of specialist support professionals and includes Business Development, marketing, recruitment, human capital, finance, technology, learning and development, procurement, to name but a few. Each team plays a vital role in making sure we have all the right resources, services and technology across our business.

Responsibilities

We are seeking to recruit a confident, dynamic and experienced individual who will be responsible for driving a number of Government and Transport priory accounts in Riyadh..
Working directly with members of the clients & markets team, industry leaders, and line of service drivers you will be based in Riyadh and working with the wider team across the ME region.
Work with other functional areas across the firm such as the Business Operations Team and internally within the Clients & Markets function to deliver infrastructure (such as Financial Performance Analysis, industry and client’s analysis, market share and competitor SWOT analysis and Thought Leadership) to develop an Account Management plan.
Establish and nurture strong relationships with clients across all levels of the organisations and have the ability to articulate challenges and work with Global Relationship Partners to develop relationship effectiveness, establishing and developing long-term client relationships, effectively representing client needs to ensure appropriate solutions are brought to the client
Attending and/or chair relevant internal business development meetings and drive subsequent actions.
Developing yourself personally, taking a keen interest in trends in business development/marketing and the impact on our clients so you can help shape their thinking and our success in the market.
Working closely with colleagues to share experience and best practices and encourage innovative and market leading activities.
Collaborating with colleagues across different competences within our Clients & Markets team to bring our clients high value solutions

Requirements

Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in relevant subject areas such as Engineering, Business, Finance or Marketing.
The role is to be based in Riyadh and familiarity with the Saudi market, and Connections with key clients is strongly preferred.
Understand and (where possible) experience of the Government and Transport industry.
Exposure to sales processes and commercial acumen.
Strong influencing and communications skills.
Excellent organisational skills, having the ability to prioritise workload whilst being resilient and being able to cope well under pressure and meeting tight deadlines.
Experience of account management and relationship Management in a large corporate environment.
Language Skills: Excellent communication skills (verbal and written). Fluent in English.

Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)

Degrees/Field Of Study Required

Degrees/Field of Study preferred:

Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)

Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)

Travel Requirements

0%

Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?

Yes

Government Clearance Required?

No

Job Posting End Date

title: Japanese / English Gaming Support Agent
description:
We love geeking out and gaming as much as you do. Join 5CA and help us continue building on the principle of Gamers Helping Gamers: connect with your fellow geeky agents, work comfortably from your own home, and discover what it is like to provide support for some of the most popular games in the world.

What will I do?

As a player support agent, your duties will include but not be limited to:
Handling customer support (e-mail and live chat – no phone calls) by doing things like
Help players with account issues (compromised accounts, updates, etc.)
Resolve issues regarding refunds, purchases not going through, etc.
Assist players resolve technical problems with the game
Answer gameplay inquiries and helping sort out gameplay issues
Check updates & newly released content for the game you’re supporting
Take assigned training modules to help you improve even further in your job
Attend your weekly meeting with a team of 10-15 fellow agents and your manager


In short, you will be responsible for helping players of this popular video game resolve their issues and continue enjoying the game that they love.

And don't worry - You will start your first week(s) at 5CA going through training with your fellow new agents, to make sure you are prepared for the challenges ahead. And, of course, you will be paid as if you were already working, during your training.

Working from home

Working from home is an adventure that you will love taking part in. Whether you just don't like sitting in an office 8 hours a day, dislike the commute, or you just want to spend more time at home – Working remotely is the perfect way to work in our current, digital world.

As part of this recruitment process, 5CA may conduct a screening activity on your publicly available social media accounts registered on Twitter, Linked-In, Facebook and/or Instagram. For further details, please refer to our privacy policy.

Job Requirements


You speak near-native Japanese and English at an advanced level
You are available to part-time or work full-time and in a fixed schedule
You have in-depth knowledge about gaming and you love anything related to video games
You own a PS4, or an Xbox One, or a modern gaming PC/laptop
You are a fast learner, you take initiative and are awesome at troubleshooting
You have a dedicated quiet work space, located within your own residence
Experience in a Customer Service environment or an international business setting is a plus.
You are not currently living in the Netherlands or Argentina.


PC requirements:


An internet speed minimum of 1 Mb/s download and 0,5 Mb/s upload internationally.
A minimum of 6 GB RAM memory
Your computer should run at least a 64-bit version of Windows 8 or newer, or a recently released version of macOS
An i5 processor (2,4 Ghz or faster), or better/ similar, max. 3 years old.
A Radeon R7 240 Graphics card or better/ similar.
A (smart)phone usable for two-factor authentication that runs at least:
Android 6.0 or newer
Apple iOS 10.0 or newer



We offer:


A position at a fast-growing company with ambitious A-level clients
A casual, international environment where you’ll work with people from over 40 different nationalities
Flexibility; working remotely means being able to work from anywhere in the world
No time wasted commuting between home and work
Top-notch tools, training, and colleagues


About Us

5CA a remote-first CX company working with passionate agents from all around the world. Founded in 1998, we represent some of the biggest names in gaming and tech and level up their customer and player experience.

Our community is full of digital natives and gamers that troubleshoot with care for the brands they love, from home, in their languages. We work with people from all cultures and backgrounds, and champion diversity and inclusion in all that we do.

As part of this recruitment process, 5CA may conduct a screening activity on your publicly available social media accounts registered on Twitter, Linked-In, Facebook and/or Instagram. For further details, please refer to our privacy policy.

title: Quality Controller @Siemens Mobility KSA - Female Saudi National
description:
The Riyadh Metro Project (RMP) is currently one of the world's largest infrastructure projects being under construction in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. Siemens as a part of a consortium (BACS) consisting of 4 companies is to supply the entire turnkey system for 2 driver-less metro lines including metro trains, electrification, signaling, and communications systems. Today, we are looking for a Quality Controller to join our global team in Riyadh

What are my responsibilities:


Tracking defect -Launch the defect process in ChampFx (CFX) tool
Regular meeting with lots (For making sure that the NCR is relevant )
Material Quality visual check and recorded in the LMS tool
Reporting to Quality Manager In project (QMIP) the position holder has secondary hand supervision and Support to the QC team
Determination of the product and process-related quality of requirements from the customer contract and other requirements
Establishment of the quality plan including the communication with the customer
Preparation of quality statements and reports
Follows the applicable safety rules, regulations and procedures
Performing the daily walk down site control with the client

What do I need to qualify for this job:


Bachelors degree in Engineering or any related decipline.
0-2 years of experience. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.
Solid computer skills and knowledge with Excel (Ability to develop Macro).
Saudi National.
Very good command of both the spoken and written English language.

Organization: Siemens Mobility

Company: Siemens Mobility Branch KSA

Experience Level: Early Professional

Job Type: Full-time

title: CARC Paint Specialist
description:
Contingent on Customer ApprovalResponsibilities: CARC Paint Specialist will participates in painting of systems associated with RSADF that are covered under the currently approved TAA. Wok location Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. Provides technical and engineering advice to the Director (administration/department).Participates in the implementation of preventive maintenance at all maintenance levels.Prepares areas to be painted by removing all old CARC paint, cleaning and priming surfaces and spray new CARC painting for the HAWK and Patriot equipment and related components to military specifications.Participates in opening/closing of job orders and on-the-job training (OJT).Applies approved engineering changesEnforce RSADF approved safety policies, procedures.

Performs additional and related unspecified tasks by the beneficiary. This position requires a Saudi person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.Required Skills:Must have a minimum of two (2) years experience in in paint application, safety and associated facility equipment.Must be familiar with the use and care of respirator, face protection and ventilation systems. Proficiency in English language both spoken and written. Required Education (including Major):

Bachelor degree in Engineering or Applied Science from an accredited university. OR Equivalent experience on the basis of two (2) additional years of experience for each one (1) year of higher education.

title: Global Recruitment Manager
description:
Our Purpose

At Krypt, we’re changing the way consulting is executed. Combining finesse, expertise, and understanding, our team is solving the most daunting SAP business and system challenges. Our mission is to be the trusted partner in the Supply Chain Execution and Compliance areas. We empower our clients by innovating their business processes. We've also created a very collaborative and easy-going corporate culture, where everyone feels involved and encouraged to make a difference and become a leader. If this sounds like a fit, we want to hear from you!




Krypt EMEA is growing, and we are looking for an experienced, enthusiastic, and result-focused Global Recruitment Manager responsible for overseeing the global recruitment team and directly managing all EMEA recruitment.







What will your day look like?

Lead a team of recruitment specialists located across the globe responsible for identifying and hiring top talent
manage the day to day operations of the recruitment process; provide expert guidance and training to recruiters
Understand and manage challenges in our key hiring locations
Coordinate with leaders to forecast department goals and hiring needs
Run the full-cycle recruitment processes from sourcing, screening, and coordinating interviews up to closing candidates for both permanent and contract staffing in EMEA
Headhunt and identify suitable candidates from IT Professional services industry
Work with business leaders on annual global campus recruitment program
Identify suitable best practice training programs for recruiters, hiring managers and business leaders
Promote Krypt’s reputation as a great place to work by being Krypt's employer brand ambassador (employer branding efforts)
Explore and implement innovative sourcing strategies
Keep up-to-date with new technological trends and products.







Skills and attributes for success:

Bachelor’s degree with proven work experience as a Technical Recruiter, preferably someone who has been recruited in the Professional Services space.
Prior experience leading global recruitment team
Related work history directly overseeing, mentoring, carrying out periodic formal reviews, and training a team of two or more recruiters
Advanced knowledge and familiarity with the use of social networking sites for recruitment purposes
Strong written and oral communication skills as demonstrated through clear communications with hiring managers, independent ability to successfully negotiate offers with candidates, and experience training both staff and hiring managers in best-recruiting practices
Hands-on experience with various interview formats (e.g., Phone, Hangouts)
Technical expertise with an ability to understand and explain job requirements for ERP roles
Experience with Applicant Tracking Systems and resume databases.
Solid knowledge of sourcing techniques (e.g., social media recruiting, Boolean search, advanced search, networking, referrals, meetups, etc.)
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and Google Suite.







We are only as successful as the people who work with us. In addition to being a great place to work, Krypt offers the following benefits (benefits may differ based on different regions and local regulations):




Career growth
Learning opportunities
Interesting, challenging projects with Global MNCs, working on innovative technologies
Exposure to niche skills in areas of SAP Supply chain management like TM, GTS, EWM, IBP, etc.
Talented, passionate, and collaborative team - the best experts within the industry
Flexibility and autonomy.










Krypt values diversity and inclusivity in our company and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Receptionist - Arabic speaking
description:
The Company

Our client, an international legal firm are hiring an experienced Receptionist to join their growing team. You will be a part of an established business who support a diverse portfolio of clients. A Saudi National would be preferred but if you are an Arabic speaker you will also be considered.

The Role

Meet and greet staff, clients and visitors, ensuring they are dealt with in a professional and helpful manner
Thorough regular checks during the day of the reception area and conference rooms, ensuring high standards are maintained
Arranging dispatch/collection of all couriered items and maintaining a log of all bookings made. Keeping accurate record details of client charges, personal charges or administration charges.
Working alongside the IT Team, particularly in connection with conference room requirements, e.g. audio/visual set-up and visitor needs
Managing the office premises by responding to emergencies and placing calls with relevant contractors/helpdesks
Negotiating pricing and terms for goods and services;
Planning and briefing of contractors for maintenance, general tasks and office moves

The Candidate

Exceptional client service skills
Excellent communication in Arabic and English
Good working knowledge of Outlook, Word, Excel and Internet
Thrive under pressure

Salary And Benefits

Up to 10,000 aed per month

Robert Half is committed to equal opportunity and diversity. Suitable candidates with equivalent qualifications and more or less experience can apply. Pay and salary ranges are dependent upon experience, qualifications and training. If you wish to apply, please read our Privacy Notice describing how we may process, disclose and store your personal data: www.roberthalf.ae/privacy-statement

title: GIS Engineer
description:
We are WSP - Join us and make your career future ready!

Think bigger scale. Think higher profile. Think ground-breaking. Join WSP, and you’ll be at the heart of a team of international experts all dedicated to growing and sharing their expertise, and working on projects that transform society for all of us.

WSP is looking for a GIS Engineer to provide geographical information system support on a major mixed-use development in Jeddah. Working closely with various disciplines including Project Controls, Design, Construction, and key role-players / stakeholders to develop and maintain the GIS database in support of the Programme needs.

Your new role, what's involved?

Provide technical and administration assistance
Manage operations of GIS equipment, software, data, and products
Responsible for building and maintaining GIS databases and utilising the GIS software
Collect, manage, analyse, model, and present geographic or spatial data
Using various criteria to examine and analyse information, designing databases, connecting GIS
Supporting in the development and management of GIS applications that are based on project & WSP requirements
Developing and managing control quality standards for system application
Overseeing data flow, management, and distribution activities that are aimed at supporting GIS
Supporting and participating in the designing and development of the geospatial database
Maintaining up-to-date and accurate geospatial documentation for reference purposes
Staying up to date or abreast with the latest developments in the GIS field
Efficiently managing geospatial database and developing in the GIS field
Efficiently managing geospatial database and developing effective maps and aerial photograph
Work closely with project staff as required

We'd Love To Hear From You If You Have
Bachelor’s Degree in one of Geography, Computer Science, Surveying, Engineering, Earth Science, or related subjects
Minimum of 10 years’ experience in the field of GIS and GIS Systems
3 to 5 years’ experience in utilizing software tools and applications, including but not limited to:
ArcGIS Desktop (ArcMap and ArcGIS Pro)
ArcGIS Online
ArcGIS Enterprise (Portal, Server)
Creating Web Maps and Geo Apps in ArcGIS Online and Portal
Developing Python Scripts using ArcPy
Very proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel
Knowledge of GIS Software, Systems and Tools available in industry
Experience with data management
Experience documenting and maintaining configuration and process information
Knowledge and experience in performing information security practices in the management and delivery of GIS Services
Ability to work under pressure and operate in a high-pressure, fast-paced environment
Providing training and skills transfer to support staff and identified areas
Thorough working knowledge and subject matter expert (SME) relating to GIS Solutions – w.r.t design, implementation, customizing, shaping, analytics, troubleshooting and overall solution

What's in it for you?

What if we can?

What if we can have work-life balance? What if we can be rewarded in ways that support our individual needs? What if we can be accepted for who we are? Here at WSP – we can!

WSP recognizes that work is only one part of our lives and making time for the other things in our life is important – be that our families, our friends or ourselves. So, if working from home, working part-time or having flexible start and finish time will help with this let us know as part of your application.

As well as rewarding you with competitive pay, WSP offers standard benefits including first class medical cover, generous annual leave, and paid professional subscriptions.

Be you, be happy - we strive to have a friendly and inclusive culture which respects and maximizes the contribution individuals can bring to WSP. We recognise the benefits that people with varying backgrounds and experiences can bring. Here at WSP we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy or maternity/paternity. We will interview all disabled applicants who meet the essential criteria.

title: Director of Inside Sales, Trilogy (Remote) - $200,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?

Are you a global software sales professional whose total compensation is up to $200,000 USD? Are you a student of the sale who is ready to teach the class? Are you obsessed with quality? If so, read on.

What You Will Be Doing

To drive retention and account growth, we work hard on delighting our customers and putting our resources into making them successful with our products. You will get to hone your performance management skills and constantly make your team better for our customers.

You'll set the standard for the team and keep raising it. Take your expertise and ability to make the team perform at your level. Have an impact as you drive performance at scale while staying close to the action.

Following an extensive and regular review of the sales team's real work, this role will spend most of their day leveraging their software sales expertise to drive team improvements:

Doing detailed win/loss analysis to coach and improve sales coaching.
Using product information and playbooks to develop and refine high-quality content (conversation plans, email templates, discovery questions, etc.)
Developing system-level insights and documenting data-driven important actions that drive programmatic improvements across the platform
Writing high impact proposals to improve how the selling is done

You may also spend some time maintaining a sharp edge by directly engaging in sales discussions with customers.

What You Won’t Be Doing

This role is not about the dark arts of sales forecasting, cold calling, closing, nickel, and diming customers, air miles, or relying on your gut. It is not about earning a commission.

You will not lead the customer conversation, and you will not be the one closing the deals.

Director Of Inside Sales Key Responsibilities

Instead of having you chase a quota with potentially misaligned incentives, we are willing to give you certainty on comp because we know what we need you to do to drive results. We are obsessed with quality - we make the tools and the team great and let results follow from there. You will not be exposed/dependent on other parts of the organization dropping the ball. You are responsible for raising the performance of the whole sales team to that of the top performers through a relentless focus on quality.

Basic Requirements

At least 5 years experience in global B2B SaaS/software sales
Consciously adept at top-down selling
Bachelors Degree or equivalent work experience
Ability to synthesize product information even when it gets a little technical

Nice-to-have Requirements

Coaching training
Telco or marketing solutions sales experience
Performance management training
Data analytics training

About Trilogy

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
Crossover Job Code: LJ-4420-SA-Riyadh-DirectorofInsi.001

title: Store Keeper
description:
plans and performs work that involves ordering, receiving, inspecting, returning, unloading, shelving, packing, labelling, pricing, delivering, and maintaining a perpetual inventory of forms, office supplies, and various types of equipment. Rotates stock and arranges for disposal of surpluses

Responsibilities


Maintain receipt and records of daily of in/out goods
Response time and accuracy of response
Has good communication skills
Manage workers and monitor their progress, and be able to prioritize received requests
Be able to determine which goods need a special treatment and have the logic to decide whether to proceed with the request or not
Make sure that all goods are on hand based on the customer needs
Inspect deliveries for damage or discrepancies, and report it to Purchase Department for claims
Be aware of Warehouse consumptions needs, such as, office supplies and equipment repairs and follow up until the request is delivered

title: Head of TV Production
description:
Job Description

Responsibilities:

Creating a production strategy and annual plans for the company
Selecting and hiring technical crew members and actors
Creating auditioning styles for testing new screen talent
Determining loopholes and shortages in a manner that reduces the cost of corrective measures and minimizes production blunders
Attracting new acting talent and finding adequate opportunities in a manner that benefits the company
Determining work priorities, assigning tasks, and inspiring production crews to aim for achieving the best results
Providing the adequate environment and training tools to develop the capabilities of the creative team
Overseeing the final image of all projects and ensuring its compliance with the initial intended concepts
Possession of a high level of cinematic and TV content understanding with knowledge about latest trends, schools, and currents
Supervising shooting schedules, daily commercial aspects of production, and the work of field-based crews
Making budget-related decisions in a manner that ensures the best possible result regarding the final product
Supervising all production-related contracts to ensure its legal phrasing protects the company’s rights and guarantees the sound execution of its projects
Creating a logistical plan and a detailed shooting schedule
Supervising script breakdown for budget and scheduling purposes
Supervising initial scout location plans and providing all necessary financial arrangements
Work with the producers to create a shooting schedule that meets the scheduling needs/restrictions of the entire cast and crew, in addition to access to shooting locations
Supervise creating a budget that includes crew members, equipment and locations
Supervise hiring all crew members and contracting with various suppliers
Supervise all lodging and transport facilities needed for actors and crew members during the entire period of the shooting schedule
Supervising both schedule and budget to ensure compatibility with the original plan
Monitoring any changes in budget during production phase and informing the studio about any deviation from the original terms of the initial budget
Responsible for ensuring all locations and actors carry the correct basic requirements submitted to the production office and that all required location releases are handled individually and separately
Serve as a communication link between local authorities and the director/crew members in a way that guarantees to adhere to all local regulations and negates the risk of closing the location – thus allowing the director/crew members to focus purely on the successful execution of their shooting operations
Complement the daily production report which describes the shooting circumstances and informs about any deviation from the main shooting schedule

Requirements

University degree in Mass Communication or related field
Minimum 10 years of experience in a similar role
Must have a wide experience in cinematic or TV Production
Able to plan, organize and manage a complex production operation involving several individuals, in various positions, and the ability to organize and schedule the entire project
Excellent skills in accounting and budget management
Excellent communication skills. Must communicate effectively and efficiently with studio personnel, including executives and heads of teams, along with governmental agencies and local authorities, equipment suppliers and recruitment personnel to ensure production speed and quality
Knowledge about laws and regulations. Must be fully aware of safety and health regulations, insurance requirements, basic human resources issues, contracts, and labor law
Fluent in Arabic and English

title: Application Operation, Director
description:
Purpose

The incumbent will formulate, direct and monitor Application Operation function, formulate and plan efficient application operation aligned to company standards and market best practices, measure performance of the application, plan and schedule application development process, allocate required resources for development and enhancement projects, manage the product roll-out and roll back process in collaboration with stakeholders, develop strategies and plans for IT integration, and ensure seamless implementation adhering to quality standards.







 Role and Responsibilities




Strategic Role

Develop department strategy in line with function and corporate strategy to ensure that the work is aligned with overall objectives of the company
 Establish performance standards and KPIs in order to achieve targeted goals, objectives and enhance performances
Develop annual budget to ensure adequate funding provisions made for the required activities
Develop policies and procedures in alignment with corporate policies and procedures and recommend changes to enhance effective implementation, if needed




Application Operation

 Ensure smooth and efficient operations of all application as per the SLA/OLA defined and delivery standards of the company.
 Develop process to measure performance of the application in relation to agreed service levels and key business drivers
 Drive process for release management and roll backs of multiple products in adherence to corporate quality standards
 Formulate production changes to resolve any identified technical issues and ensure monitoring for all applications in production.
 Maintain DevOps (CI – Continuous Integration / CD – Continuous Delivery) practices for production and pre-production environment to shorten the systems application development life cycle and provide continuous delivery with high quality.
 Collaborate with stakeholders to estimate and schedule the application deployments in K8s platforms and allocate required resources for software development project to ensure on time release.
 Formulate plan to acquire, and maintain tools to improve the efficiency of the operations and technical support, and ensure compliance to standard operating procedures 
Develop process to identify operational priorities and determine project objectives, such as, efficiency, cost savings etc.




Integration Operation:

 Ensure smooth and efficient operations of all application integration layer as per the SLA/OLA defined and delivery standards of the company.
 Develop process to measure performance of the application integration in relation to agreed service levels and key business drivers.
 Formulate Integration production changes to resolve any identified technical issues and ensure monitoring for all applications in production.
 Collaborate with stakeholders to estimate and schedule the Integration deployments and allocate required resources for software development project to ensure on time release.
 Formulate plan to acquire, and maintain tools to meet the required for integration operation as per company standard
Direct the implementation of continuous improvements in the existing applications’ integration to achieve higher productivity and efficiency for internal and external users




People Management Role

Develop cordial business relations with the key stakeholders, through discussion and analysis of performance results, market insights, potential future collaboration
 Ensure function is performing its work in accordance with established standards and remain abreast of emerging trends and best practices in the industry
 Participate to recruit, guide, direct and supervise direct reporting staff and ensure their career development, performance management and keep them motivate to deliver challenging projects
 Collaborate cross-functionally within the company, identify and evaluate new relevant methodologies and technologies and make recommendations on opportunities for improvement




Education

 Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology Engineering or Business Administration 
Master Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology / Engineering or Business Administration is preferred




Qualifications

 Certification in standard Software Development Lifecycles (SDLC) methodologies
Certification in standard Software Quality Management tools/methodology
 DevOps methodologies.
 K8s platforms.
 ITIL v4.




Years and Nature of Experience

 7 years’ experience of customer application development, deployment, asset/infrastructure management, enterprise integration and roll-outs in IT industry preferably in B2B environment
Experience in interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels including the executive level

title: Thai / English Team Lead
description:
We love geeking out and gaming as much as you do. Join 5CA and help us continue building on the principle of Gamers Helping Gamers: connect with your fellow geeky agents, work comfortably from your own home, and discover what it is like to provide support for some of the most popular games in the world.

What will I do?

As a player support agent, your duties will include but not be limited to:
Handling customer support (e-mail and live chat – no phone calls) by doing things like
Help players with account issues (compromised accounts, updates, etc.)
Resolve issues regarding refunds, purchases not going through, etc.
Assist players resolve technical problems with the game
Answer gameplay inquiries and helping sort out gameplay issues
Check updates & newly released content for the game you’re supporting
Take assigned training modules to help you improve even further in your job
Attend your weekly meeting with a team of 10-15 fellow agents and your manager


In short, you will be responsible for helping players of this popular video game resolve their issues and continue enjoying the game that they love.

And don't worry - You will start your first week(s) at 5CA going through training with your fellow new agents, to make sure you are prepared for the challenges ahead. And, of course, you will be paid as if you were already working, during your training.

Working from home

Working from home is an adventure that you will love taking part in. Whether you just don't like sitting in an office 8 hours a day, dislike the commute, or you just want to spend more time at home – Working remotely is the perfect way to work in our current, digital world.

As part of this recruitment process, 5CA may conduct a screening activity on your publicly available social media accounts registered on Twitter, Linked-In, Facebook and/or Instagram. For further details, please refer to our privacy policy.

Job Requirements


You speak near-native Thai and English
You are available to part-time or work full-time and in a fixed schedule
You have in-depth knowledge about gaming and you love anything related to video games
You own a PS4, or an Xbox One, or a modern gaming PC/laptop
You are a fast learner, you take initiative and are awesome at troubleshooting
You have a dedicated quiet work space, located within your own residence
Experience in a Customer Service environment or an international business setting is a plus.
You are not currently living in the Netherlands, the United States of America, or Argentina.


PC requirements:


An internet speed minimum of 1 Mb/s download and 0,5 Mb/s upload internationally.
A minimum of 6 GB RAM memory
Your computer should run at least a 64-bit version of Windows 8 or newer, or a recently released version of macOS
An i5 processor (2,4 Ghz or faster), or better/ similar, max. 3 years old.
A Radeon R7 240 Graphics card or better/ similar.
A (smart)phone usable for two-factor authentication that runs at least:
Android 6.0 or newer
Apple iOS 10.0 or newer



We offer:


A position at a fast-growing company with ambitious A-level clients
A casual, international environment where you’ll work with people from over 40 different nationalities
Flexibility; working remotely means being able to work from anywhere in the world
No time wasted commuting between home and work
Top-notch tools, training, and colleagues


About Us

5CA a remote-first CX company working with passionate agents from all around the world. Founded in 1998, we represent some of the biggest names in gaming and tech and level up their customer and player experience.

Our community is full of digital natives and gamers that troubleshoot with care for the brands they love, from home, in their languages. We work with people from all cultures and backgrounds, and champion diversity and inclusion in all that we do.

As part of this recruitment process, 5CA may conduct a screening activity on your publicly available social media accounts registered on Twitter, Linked-In, Facebook and/or Instagram. For further details, please refer to our privacy policy.

title: Ingénieur Commercial (h/f/d) – BIM/CIM - Ile de France
description:
FARO est une entreprise d'imagerie - et une entreprise imaginative. Nous cherchons à concevoir un monde meilleur, plus perspicace, et plus performant, grâce à des outils numériques 3D et des technologies de mesure. Depuis toujours, nous avons aidé nos clients à prendre de meilleures décisions, plus rapidement et précisément que n'importe qui d'autre dans l'industrie.

Nous travaillons avec les plus grandes entreprises de la planète pour fournir les solutions leur permettant de surmonter leurs défis industriels les plus urgents. Dans l'aérospatiale et l'automobile, nous travaillons avec des entreprises comme SpaceX, la NASA, Tesla et Volvo, entre autres. Dans l'industrie de la construction, nous travaillons avec les plus grandes marques pour numériser et concevoir des projets étonnants. Pour les professionnels de la sécurité publique, nos outils d'analyse médico-légale résolvent des crimes et documentent des scènes avec du matériel de haute technologie que vous avez certainement déjà vu dans la série CSI ou au cinéma !

Nous sommes convaincus que si cela peut être rêvé, cela peut aussi être mesuré, et si cela peut être mesuré, cela peut être réalisé !

Nous recherchons votre soutien en tant que Ingénieur Commercial (h/f/d) – BIM/CIM pour la France. En fonction de votre lieu de résidence, vous couvrirez le Nord-Est. Pour ce poste, vous travaillerez en modalité de télétravail.

Vous ferez la différence chez FARO :


En développant les comptes existants et faisant prospérer notre portefeuille AEC, et menant à bien une prospection sur le territoire visant à acquérir de nouveaux clients.
En vous responsabilisant de la négociation et conclusion favorable des ventes de systèmes et de produits, ou en générant des pistes commerciales. En sachant appliquer vos connaissances techniques approfondies des produits, y compris en matière de contrats.
En générant des revenus de vente par la démonstration des produits sur les sites de clients sélectionnés. Vous évaluerez pour cela les besoins du client, le lieu d'installation, les exigences de montage, les dessins techniques, les données CAO, les plans de GD&T et d'inspection.
En démontrant votre capacité à identifier des opportunités de vente supplémentaires en dehors des canaux traditionnels.
En utilisant toutes les ressources à votre disposition tels que la direction des ventes, les spécialistes des ventes internes, les ingénieurs d'application, le marketing ou encore d’autres outils, pour développer et conclure vos ventes.
En travaillant au sein de l'équipe de vente à générer des idées sur les opportunités de vente, les processus et les systèmes de l'entreprise.
En fournissant un retour d'information du terrain à FARO R&D et au Product Manager pour l'amélioration de notre offre.
En agissant en tant que point de contact et fournissant une assistance technique aux clients potentiels pendant les périodes d'évaluation.
En fournissant vos budgets annuels, ainsi que prévisions trimestrielles et mensuelles.


Ce poste nécessite :


Un diplôme en commerce / génie civil, BIM, architecture ou de géomètre.
Une expérience professionnelle dans un poste similaire, de préférence dans le domaine de l'architecture, le génie civil ou de la construction.
Une bonne capacité de communication pour déterminer les besoins du client.
Un esprit innovateur et créatif, une personnalité flexible, impliquée et proactive.
Une bonne connaissance des processus techniques et des logiciels utilisés dans les domaines de la construction et associés à l’utilisation du Laser Scanner
Une bonne capacité à travailler en équipe.
Vous parlez couramment le français (idéalement, votre langue maternelle), et possédez un bon niveau d’anglais, à l'oral et à l'écrit.
Vous avez une prédisposition pour le télétravail, et êtes disponible pour voyager de 50% à 75 % de votre temps.


FARO propose :


En général, un contrat de travail à durée indéterminée
Une rémunération attractive (salaire fixe plus commissions)
Horaires et lieu de travail flexibles
Possibilité de formation continue
Autres événements et avantages pour les employés
Voiture, téléphone portable et ordinateur portable de l'entreprise


Compris

Chez FARO, nous nous engageons à encourager différentes perspectives et idées qui favorisent l'innovation. Nous croyons que nous sommes les plus forts avec une équipe diversifiée d'employés. Nous voulons que chaque employé de FARO ressente notre engagement à faire preuve de respect envers tous et à encourager une collaboration et une communication ouvertes.

Rejoignez-nous. Faites partie d'une organisation dynamique qui valorise la qualité, le leadership, le travail d'équipe, l'honnêteté et l'ouverture comme mode de vie dans la conduite de nos affaires.

title: Store Keeper
description:
plans and performs work that involves ordering, receiving, inspecting, returning, unloading, shelving, packing, labelling, pricing, delivering, and maintaining a perpetual inventory of forms, office supplies, and various types of equipment. Rotates stock and arranges for disposal of surpluses

Maintain receipt and records of daily of in/out goods
Response time and accuracy of response
Has good communication skills
Manage workers and monitor their progress, and be able to prioritize received requests

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
About Jisr:

At Jisr, you’ll enjoy a welcoming and casual environment, company retreats, and the ability to interact with and learn from a growing Startup. We work hard and care about our most prized asset - our people.

We’re helping businesses get off the ground by enabling them to focus on running their business. We solve HR issues.

We’re data-driven and never stop iterating. If you’d like to work in a supportive, entrepreneurial environment, and are interested in building something meaningful and having fun while doing it, we’d love to hear from you.

Your Mission

At Jisr, We're on a mission to make the work-life simpler, more pleasant, and more productive for everyone, employees and managers. This mission starts with our own team. We're building a strong and diverse team of competent, creative, and committed people who want to be a part of something impactful.

Your Duties:

Collaborate on problems with experts in different fields ranging from Back-end engineers to HR specialists.

-Develop a deep understanding of the people you’re designing for by identifying their motivations, needs, expectations, and goals, and translating these into compelling experiences.

-Design flows and experiences that simplify complexity into usable interfaces.

-Deliver high-quality solutions and work with the engineering team to make them come to life.

-Inform and validate your UX designs with user research and user testing.

-Drive a partnership with product managers, engineers and user researchers to oversee the user experience of a product from conception to launch.

-Identify success metrics and measure the impact of your work.

-Join workshops and critique sessions to bring forward new ideas and continuously improve our products and processes.

Your competencies:

Our compensation philosophy supports our business and people strategies, and our culture of meritocracy. At Jisr we always are looking to attract and retain top talent to be competitive and win in the marketplace.

Qualifications:

-Got strong capacity to identify, analyze, describe user needs, behaviors, and usage patterns.

-Got outstanding written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to present work to multidisciplinary teams

-Have an online portfolio and can showcase your work.

Experiences:

2-3 Years of experience

Skills:

-Got strong knowledge of user research methodologies and tools and a thorough understanding of user-centric design / best practices

-Are proficient with current industry design and collaboration tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, and Miro (Experience with Hi-Fi prototyping tools like Protopine or Framer is a plus)

title: Procurement Specialist|041355 - 5003558HO
description:
The role holder is responsible for participating in all procurement activities and taking ownership of the procurement process for

Professional Services Category Management ensuring service delivery in a cost-effective manner in line with the stated strategy and defined service level agreements. The role holder shall carry out his duties in accordance with the stipulated business policies and procedures.Strategy Implementation Participates in the strategy formulation by providing support and inputs to the General Manager – Commercial Procurement.

Participates the implementation of the Sector strategy and define the broad outline of the policies and procedures for the Professional Services Category Management Department to drive achievement of the desired objectives.

Sourcing Strategy

Develops the sourcing strategy for the category and agenda setting with key stakeholders.

Defines cost drivers of the categories in scope and follows their evolution. Analyze for Professional Services category

Anticipates changes in STC needs and market conditions to define the category sourcing strategies.

Develops business cases, including need for cross-functional resources, timeframe and targets.

Analyses market studies and dynamics to adapt the sourcing strategy.

Identifying Purchasing Requirements Participates in the discussions for business requirements, project specifications and sector strategy with sectors and suppliers. Analyses historical data to provide demand/consumption trends and track deviations. Category Management Ensures all purchasing requests are received, evaluated for completeness and classified according to value (e.g., risk, financial) and assigned to buyers.

Takes ownership of execution-focused service delivery functions and processes.

Oversees the payment request process after confirmation from business owners of closure of the work orders.

Predicts categories trends and development (technologies evolution, new business model, suppliers’ consolidation etc.) Supports the Finance Sector by giving clear price roadmap/trends to prepare the budget. Tracks supply market trends (competitive pressures, new entrants, substituting products or services, changes in the value chain) to accordingly build in changes in the Department and ensure alignment to best practices. Develops category classification and maps it to spend base.

Coordinates business planning efforts with the General Manager – Commercial Procurement. Vendor Management and Risk Assessment

Manages relationships with external suppliers supporting Professional Services Category Management through the procurement process; selection of appropriate vendor, and evaluation of their service delivery and performance.

Ensures an updated database of suppliers and maintains cataloguing of recommended suppliers.

Investigates supply and financial risks of suppliers and takes appropriate actions.

title: Information Security GRC Consultant
description:
Our Client

A world renown Energy & Chemicals Company based in Saudi Arabia are looking for a Information Security GRC Consultant on a permanent basis.




Your Responsibilities

Responsible to define and govern the Global Cybersecurity Program, set strategic directions and requirements to strengthen the global cybersecurity posture.
This entails developing cybersecurity frameworks and policies, reference architecture and performing various cybersecurity assessments to identify gaps across people, process and technology.
The position also includes managing and executing cybersecurity programs and initiative that apply to the company and its affiliates.




Your Qualifications

Hold a Bachelor of Science (BS) OR Bachelor of Arts (BA) Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Technology (MIS), Engineering, Physical Sciences
You should have a minimum of 5-10 years of experience in information security, cybersecurity or a related technical field
You should have experience in cybersecurity Governance, risk and compliance management.
You should have experience in managing cybersecurity programs and initiatives.
You should have an advanced understanding of IT related processes such as system/application development and change management, networking, and computing.
Certifications/Credentials: (CISM, CISSP, CRISC or CRMA)
Thoroughly proficient in both verbal and written English.




Halian Group

With over 20 years of experience, we have come to understand that innovation is the only way to provide agile, practical solutions that transform businesses and careers. Our resourcing and smart services help you to realize tomorrow’s potential. Discover the amazing things possible when you bring the right people and the right technologies together.

title: Waiter/ess
description:
A Waiter/ess is responsible for serving guests in a friendly, timely, and efficient manner to deliver an excellent Guest and Member experience while having extensive knowledge of menu offerings.

What will I be doing?

Responsibilities

Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards

As a Waiter/ess, you are responsible for serving guests in a friendly, timely, and efficient manner to deliver an excellent Guest and Member experience. A Waiter/ess will also be required to have extensive knowledge of menu offerings.

Manage guest queries in a friendly, timely, and efficient manner
Serve Alcoholic/non-Alcoholic beverages in conjunction with licensing/liquor regulations for residents and non-residents
Ensure knowledge of menu and all products
Ensure mis-en-place is well stocked at all floor stations
Follow correct reporting procedures if faced with issues
Ensure Food and Beverage orders are of a consistently good standard and delivered in a timely manor
Practice Hilton Grooming standards including uniform dress code, cleanliness and personal hygiene
Comply with hotel security, fire regulations and all health and safety legislation
What are we looking for?

Skills

To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow

A Waiter/ess serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.

Positive attitude
Good communication skills
Committed to delivering high levels of customer service
Excellent grooming standards
Flexibility to respond to a range of different work situations
Ability to work on your own or in teams

It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:

Experience in Food and Beverage department and/or industry
Previous experience of cash handling
Knowledge of Food Hygiene Regulations

What will it be like to work for Hilton?

Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision “to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality” unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!

Work Locations

Hilton Garden Inn Tabuk

Schedule

Full-time

Brand

Hilton Garden Inn

Shift

Day Job

Job Level

Team Member

Job

Bars and Restaurants

title: Relationship Manager, CopperTree (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, CopperTree. Have you got what it takes?

Are you an expert at employing technical expertise to drive business results? Do you enjoy guiding customers on how to best use software products? If you find the thought of helping customers achieve business goals exciting, we have the perfect job for you.

Reducing customer churn is a serious profit driver for SaaS products, yet most companies are laser-focused on customer acquisition through shiny new features. At CopperTree, we support every customer to get the most value from our omnichannel customer care solution through a dedicated customer success team.

Typical account management has you reacting to every customer request or whim to keep them happy, but this role is different. You will create customer-specific success plans and lead meetings to implement them, combining your product expertise and a deep understanding of customers' needs to make impactful recommendations that drive customer value growth.

Are you excited about boosting your SaaS knowledge while helping major clients achieve their objectives? Apply today!

What You Will Be Doing

Creating Success Plans. You will evaluate product usage to identify improvement opportunities for each customer and create customer-specific plans that help them obtain more value from our product.
Leading Success Meetings. You will show customers where they currently stand in the success journey and provide confident, clear recommendations to improve value realization.

What You Won’t Be Doing

Providing account or technical support. Rather than chasing down support tickets or handling service requests, you will be focused on increasing customer success.
Giving generalized recommendations. Each success plan is unique and based on customer-specific use cases.

Relationship Manager Key Responsibilities

Ensure customers successfully use the product and are satisfied with its value delivery, contributing to customer retention and growth.

Basic Requirements

At least 2 years of experience in a customer-facing role for a software company
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Availability to work at least 60% of the time between 9 am and 5 pm BST (British Standard Time)

About CopperTree

CopperTree is the simplest omni-channel customer care solution for small and medium businesses or branch offices.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
Crossover Job Code: LJ-4806-SA-Riyadh-RelationshipMa.001

Android 4.4 or newer

title: IT Assistant
description:
Role Purpose

Maintain and monitor computer and network systems, software and hardware while providing the required assistance to all employees in a timely manner. Installing and configuring computer systems, diagnosing hardware and software faults and solving technical problems are also core duties to the IT support officers.

Accountabilities

Install and update operating systems and related company’s software.
Diagnose software, hardware, network errors, and solve the issues in the shortest period.
Install, configure, and troubleshoot all technology related devices; printers, scanners, desk phones…etc.
Support all company users’ software and hardware issues/requests through e-mail, system alerts…etc.
Monitor data center facility and the processing of critical systems/servers.
Issue periodic reports to the IT manager to communicate the progress of the necessary activities and tasks.
Perform the required imaging and backup on regular basis to maintain the data from being lost or damaged.
Support and liaise with vendors for hardware or software fixes to ensure effectiveness of the devices at all times.

Job holder accountabilities are not limited to the above mentioned, the line manager can assign additional responsibilities when required.

Education

Bachelor’s degree in IT or computer programming. Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science or equivalent
Certifications/accreditations in IT is a plus

Experience

32 to 7 years of experience in a similar role
Previous GCC experience is a plus

Behavioral Competencies

Analytical thinking
Problem solving
Creativity & innovation
Planning & organizing
Communication

title: Remote Work Evangelist (Remote) - $200,000/year USD
description:
Are you a star career coach stuck in 'InHuman' Resources? Most (I)HR departments are still stuck rounding up the local fauna and ensuring they don't escape. If you believe the future of work is remote, and want to build HR for remote workers worldwide, this is the role for you.

The pandemic has accelerated the inevitable adoption of remote work, but it is still Day One. Currently, remote work simply means attending zoom meetings from home a few days each week. We believe the future is much more – fully remote careers where workers build their skills to find transformative opportunities in a global work marketplace. No one has written the HR playbook for this new world. Do you want to help write it?

What You Will Be Doing

Build and research ideas on what it means to be a remote worker – What skills are valuable, and how should you acquire them? Should you work as a contractor or a full-time employee? Does it even matter?
Express these ideas with an edge. This is a writing job. You will write compelling content every week and become the go-to resource for workers seeking to build remote careers
Help employers understand, recruit, retain and retrain a global workforce. Write their HR playbooks for them, one post at a time
Design and build surveys, questionnaires, and tests that help workers and employers understand their capabilities, needs, and opportunities

What You Won’t Be Doing

Designing, compiling, or analyzing quarterly or annual performance reviews
Building exercises that hold back careers instead of advancing them
Determining team sizes or compensation

Remote Work Evangelist Key Responsibilities

Writing. This job is primarily outward-facing. You need to produce engaging content that can help launch a million careers.
Develop HR frameworks and associated exercises to help workers understand and plan their careers
Simplify skill-based recruiting for both employers and workers
Provide advice on compensation, taxation, and savings for both contractors and employees

Basic Requirements

A university degree (BA/MS, MS, or PhD) with English as a language of instruction
HR/recruiting experience at mid to large-size firms (at least 50 people)
A track record of being a content generator - either individually or in an org - who has published at least 10 pieces of original content this year
Extroversion and empathy
The ability to channel that extroversion into engaging and frequent content

Nice-to-have Requirements

Remote work experience
Video/graphic content skills

About Crossover

Crossover has been a pioneer of the remote work model since our inception in 2010 - helping thousands of people advance their careers. We focus on full-time, long-term work - not short-term "gigs" or freelancing side jobs. Our platform provides businesses with the fairest hiring on earth by basing 90% of the decisions on objective assessments of a candidate's skills and abilities to perform Real Work. Since we are 100% remote, people can work from anywhere and earn standardized and competitive compensation, regardless of where they choose to live.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
Crossover Job Code: LJ-4799-SA-Riyadh-RemoteWorkEvan.001

title: Alternance 12 mois - Alternant chargé d'études actuarielles (H/F)
description:
Réactif(ve), rigoureux(se), organisé(e), vous cherchez un poste où vos compétences sont valorisées. Vous souhaitez travailler en équipe et évoluer dans une entreprise qui met ses collaborateurs au cœur de sa stratégie de développement !

La Direction Technique & Produits Assurances de Biens et de Responsabilité recherche un alternant chargé d’études actuarielles pour rejoindre l’équipe en charge du Pricing de l’ensemble des branches Particuliers, Professionnels et Mid-Corp Standard.

L’équipe Pricing est notamment responsable au sein d’Allianz France et auprès du Groupe Allianz, de la modélisation du tarif technique et commercial des risques Non-Vie, du suivi de l’adéquation du tarif, du respect des normes édictées par le Groupe ALLIANZ dans la mise en place des tarifs techniques, du suivi de la concurrence et de la sensibilité clients pour optimiser les tarifs commerciaux, de la pertinence technique des outils de tarification utilisés et de l’utilisation de méthodes et de modèles innovants dans le domaine de l’Actuariat (Big Data, Machine Learning).

Au sein de l’équipe Pricing, vous aurez pour missions principales :


Participer à la modélisation des garanties du produit Immeuble
Participer à la mise à jour du tarif technique du produit Immeuble
Participer à la mise en place d’outils de monitoring
Participer à la mise à jour des outils de tarification


Profil / Compétences :


Vous préparez un master en Actuariat / Statistiques et disposez éventuellement d'une première expérience technique en assurance
Vous avez une bonne connaissance des techniques actuarielles
Vous maitrisez le Pack Office et l’outil SAS. Python serait un plus
Vous êtes volontaire, travailleur, curieux et pragmatique
Vous êtes capable de travailler en équipe, tous en sachant avancer indépendamment dans votre travail
Vous parlez anglais


Informations complémentaires :


Alternance de 12 mois à pourvoir pour début septembre 2022 (apprentissage ou professionnalisation sous condition que le titre ou le diplôme soit inscrit au RNCP)
Merci de transmettre votre candidature complète (CV & lettre de motivation en précisant vos dates de disponibilité, la durée et le rythme pour l’alternance)
Localisation du poste : Lyon

title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer, Virtasant (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Virtasant. Have you got what it takes?

Are you an expert at detecting differences between things you observe versus what you expect them to be? Do you love technology and have a passion for constantly learning new things? Are you excited about executing and automating tests for a suite of multiple, varied software solutions?

Virtasant helps companies thrive in the cloud by building cloud-native solutions, migrating solutions using our highly automated approach, or even managing entire cloud infrastructures so that companies can focus on their businesses. We have assembled a team of some of the world's best cloud experts, and in the QA team, we will guide you through test scripts that are clear and specific so that you can focus on deciding whether an application meets our high standards for quality. Unlike most QA Testers that test the same application every day, you will learn and test dozens of different products from the 100+ that our customer owns.

If you share our obsession with product quality and want to learn and grow by working on a broad range of software solutions, we would love to hear from you.

What You Will Be Doing

Execute test cases with high precision and detail, diligently checking each step and documenting differences
Following a process that includes testing in two-hour "Deep Work blocks"

What You Won’t Be Doing

Coding - using Gherkin, you will be able to automate QA tests without any coding experience.
Editing unit or integration tests - these are done by our software engineers.

Software Quality Assurance Engineer Key Responsibilities

Ensuring that every product you are assigned from our portfolio meets our rigorous quality standards

Basic Requirements

A university degree (BS, MS, or Ph.D.) that included an in-depth study of data structures, algorithms, object-oriented programming, computer architecture, and software engineering
Four yrs of experience as a QA Engineer
Experience utilizing Selenium and Postman
Experience with API testing
Willingness to work overlapping at least five daily hours in the US EST Time zone

About Virtasant

Virtasant is a global cloud services provider with industry-leading technology, capabilities, and people. We've been working in the cloud, testing the limits of its capabilities, since the start. We transform, build, and optimize customers' digital experience in the cloud every day, helping companies make the most of the cloud's native capabilities. To achieve this, we've built one of the world's largest fully remote organizations.

To maintain the high quality of services that Virtasant is offering, we give all our employees a chance of attaining official cloud certification which helps them develop and grow themselves faster.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
