title: Marine Construction Manager
description:
In view of our prospect marine projects, we are currently looking for an experienced Marine Construction Manager to join our construction team working on our projects, in KSA.

Are you an adventurer? Do you enjoy working with different cultures and travelling around the world? Build on a mission that matters.

Role Summary:

Reporting to the Project Manager, you will be responsible for all delivery aspects of the project scope (planning and coordination) ensuring the maximum allocation of resources and that effective controls and procedures are in place.

As a leader of this team, you will be required to create an environment of exceptional team performance, ensure team roles, skills and behavior are aligned with the Project's objectives and requirements.

What you will need to do:

Plan and coordinate all the construction activities towards achieving the construction deliverables and ensure the project will be completed in high quality and according to schedule
Develop Construction Executive Plans, including constructability plans
Manage various contractors and suppliers
Manage the expenses throughout the construction and be able to adjust as necessary
Ensure that all processes are in place to prevent accidents (HSE excellence is one of the most important values for Archirodon)
Develop three (3) months look-ahead schedules and report progress
Develop presentations for the Site management team




What you will need to have:

Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering
Minimum ten (10) years of overall work experience on large marine projects (>100M USD), working for a Tier 1 contractor
Minimum three (3) years of work experience as Construction Manager in large marine projects, working for a Tier 1 contractor
At least ONE (1) successfully delivered EPC (aka DB) project as a Construction Manager, with the below specification:

- jetty with at least 300m long access trestle on piles

Proven exposure to marine construction activities such as piling, concreting and installations, and marine equipment such as floating crane and jack-up barges
Demonstrated commitment to QHSE and knowledge of marine construction QHSE requirements
Proven experience in developing Construction Execution Plans, including constructability plans
Previous experience in preparing Method Statements, including heavy lift and transportation studies
Experience in managing teams where innovative construction methods have been utilized.
Ability to develop lookahead schedules and report progress
Excellent command (written and oral) of the English language




What is nice to have:

Previous construction Site experience in UAE and KSA leading multidisciplinary projects
Sub-contractor experience would be a definite asset
Good command (written and oral) of French and/or Arabic




We are someone who:

Displays good communication skills (written and oral) and builds rapport easily
Can be counted on to achieve goals, demonstrating a fighting spirit and perseverance
Is keen to learn and professionally grow
Has sound Project Management Skills
Is able to foster strong working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders
Is effective at solving problems and making timely decisions
Displays a team spirit, particularly in a multicultural environment
Is commercially astute




What is in it for you:

Expat package is on the shelf, yet the real joy comes from being a member of smart and passionate teams, within an international leading EPC Group on a mission that matters. We create mega construction projects - literally around the globe - with meaningful impact on the local communities for the years to come. At Archirodon, you will find a proud, productive and human-centric culture, caring for and building on our people and their development.




Please note that you will be contacted only in case you are shortlisted for an interview. In the meantime, do not hesitate to stay in touch and keep monitoring our open vacancies and our LinkedIn page! Rest assured that your application will be treated with strict confidentiality and under all applicable data privacy regulations.

title: Instrumentation Service Engineer: Open for Saudi National
description:
Job Description

The service Engineer in full cooperation and agreement with the Supervisor / Service Manager is in charge of all MDTotco

equipment on any given installation. Furthermore, he carries out the day-to-day operation and maintenance of MDTotco

Equipment & monitoring of equipment performance. He also is responsible for materials stock check and required documentation.

Also, advise clients in the field on proper operating procedures and maintenance MDTotco products.

Key Accountabilities

Repair, service, inspection and commissioning of all MDTotco products

Installation / Upgrade MDTotco products

Carry out the day to day operation and maintenance and monitoring of MDTotco Equipment for best performance.

Provide activity report on a daily basis. Depending on the type of job, different reports (service report, service tickets ...) are required

Provides detailed report about the inventory in stores location where assigned to on a weekly, monthly basis and when requested.

Clean, test and repair parts/systems available in stores where assigned to

Performance Indicators

Provide clients Training on equipment operation and maintenance.

Fast response (without crossing safety limits) to calls either from rias or the manager requests

Workshop jobs might be requested, cleaning and arranging after work is completed is a must.

Comply with all NOV Health, Safety and Environment procedures and policies

Ability to read instrumentation drawings and connect them correctly, laying down cables from one end to another.

Ability to work alone and be a team player.

Requirements

Qualification:

Bachelor's degree in mechanic / electrical engineering or equivalent.

Experience

3 years of relevant experience in instrumentation

Skill & Competencies

Basic Networking / ability to read basic electrical connections diagram /Instrumentation background.

Completed classes in basic electricity and electronics, and be intensely aware of proper safety practices and procedures when dealing with and troubleshooting electrical circuits.

Must be prepared for international travel

Must be self-motivating individual

The above list is not exhaustive and the individual may be required to carry out other tasks that Management feel are considered reasonable within the context of this role.

About Us

Every day, the oil and gas industry’s best minds put more than 150 years of experience to work to help our customers achieve lasting success.

We Power the Industry that Powers the World

Throughout every region in the world and across every area of drilling and production, our family of companies has provided the technical expertise, advanced equipment, and operational support necessary for success—now and in the future.

Global Family

We are a global family of thousands of individuals, working as one team to create a lasting impact for ourselves, our customers, and the communities where we live and work.

Purposeful Innovation

Through purposeful business innovation, product creation, and service delivery, we are driven to power the industry that powers the world better.

Service Above All

This drives us to anticipate our customers’ needs and work with them to deliver the finest products and services on time and on budget.

Organization

Wellbore Technologies

Within NOV Wellbore Technologies, we enhance drilling performance at the rig, both on land and offshore. We understand the complete process and anticipate what our customers need to be successful.

title: Operator milling machine
description:
Job Description

Duties & Responsibilities:

Under the direction of a supervisor and/or experienced machinist, responsible for quality parts produced on CNC machines such as, but not limited, to lathes and milling machines in a timely, safe, and efficient manner.

Operate, perform set-up changes and first article inspections on production runs utilizing CNC Machines.
Load parts utilizing overhead lifting equipment, proving tapes, operating controls, setting offsets, simple edits, deburring, and inspection of quality parts for conformance to requirements.
Identify problems before production runs, then start and observe machine operation to detect any other malfunctions or out-of-tolerance conditions and adjust machine controls or control media as required.
Read blueprints, precision measuring instruments and job orders to determine dimensions, tolerance, and tooling requirements.
Maintain knowledge of dimensions and tolerances for tooling instructions such as fixtures, feed rates, cutting speeds, depth of cut and cutting tools to be used.
Prove out new programs and make simple edits of CNC programs on at least one or more numerically controlled machines.
Keep equipment and work area clean and orderly and perform basic preventative maintenance functions on equipment.
Perform other work-related tasks as assigned.
Comply with all ARM Company and HSE policies and procedures.
Insure the proper utilization of equipment and material.
Make set-ups and operate equipment insuring adherence to procedures/standards while advancing ARM's quality policy.
Maintain accurate dimensional tolerances based upon drawings.
Insure paperwork is accurate and reflects the latest revision.
Use measuring tools and gauges to insure quality of product.
Report unsafe conditions, broken or malfunctioning equipment, accidents, and inquiries to supervisor.

Skills & Experience Required

Minimum 10 years of experience as CNC Machine operator.
Understanding of fabrication drawings, engineering nesting’s for milling, grinding, and lifting.
Technical knowledge of using CNC milling and boring machines and other shop tools.
Hands on experience in tool grinding , installation and commissioning.
Best practice of Storage and handling of materials and working tools.
Normal daily tasks will require to lift variable weights, use basic hand tools, push, or pull and think safety on every task.

Qualification, Knowledge, And Experience

10 years’ experience in fabrication of heavy structures and equipment.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in similar role in fabrication environment.
Diploma in Engineering/ Technical certifications required.
Experience in operation highly advanced CNC machines is required.

About Us

Every day, the oil and gas industry’s best minds put more than 150 years of experience to work to help our customers achieve lasting success.

We Power the Industry that Powers the World

Throughout every region in the world and across every area of drilling and production, our family of companies has provided the technical expertise, advanced equipment, and operational support necessary for success—now and in the future.

Global Family

We are a global family of thousands of individuals, working as one team to create a lasting impact for ourselves, our customers, and the communities where we live and work.

Purposeful Innovation

Through purposeful business innovation, product creation, and service delivery, we are driven to power the industry that powers the world better.

Service Above All

This drives us to anticipate our customers’ needs and work with them to deliver the finest products and services on time and on budget.

Organization

Rig Technologies

At NOV Rig Technologies, we are harnessing the strength of knowledge and innovation that is revolutionizing the future of energy. We build on what works, using our deep expertise to help minimize risk, increase uptime, and improve performance in drilling operations around the globe.

title: Sales Development Representative, Trilogy (Remote) - $60,000/year USD

title: Tutor (External Contractor) - Digital Transformation and Cybersecurity for Business Leaders (Middle East)
description:
Udacity is on a mission to change lives, businesses and nations through radical talent transformation in digital technologies. We offer a unique and immersive online learning platform, powering corporate technical training in fields such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Autonomous Systems, Cloud Computing and more. Our rapidly growing global organization is revolutionizing how the enterprise market bridges the talent shortage and skills gaps during their digital transformation journey. Udacity is proud to be backed by respected investors like Andreessen Horowitz, Charles River Ventures, Bertelsmann and Drive Capital, among other leading VC firms, and provides a powerful and differentiated solution inside of a $32b total addressable market opportunity. Udacity has more than 100 enterprise customers including Airbus, Bertelsmann, BNP Paribas, Leidos, Mazda, and the United States Air Force.

A Tutor functions as a technical leader within the student community and acts as the primary intermediary between Udacity students, the Community Manager, and staff. Tutors provide technical support to students within their Nanodegrees content and field, provide feedback, and build a sense of community amongst the student body. They can also manage webinars, meetups and other interventions.

We want to extend an opportunity for you to become a Tutor for this program with Udacity. All our Tutors are handpicked through a rigorous selection process so that we can truly be #studentfirst

Required Skills/qualifications

Bilingual in Arabic and English
Residing in Egypt or Saudi Arabia or UAE
Technical Competence: Business Analytics, Business Management, Business Strategy, Business Model Design Security or Information Security Management, Disaster Recovery and Computer Forensics Computer Application, Network Security IT Operations and System/Network Administration, Risk Management or Vulnerability Assessment
Experience teaching technical concepts and public speaking
Experience organizing technical talks, or webinars
Ability to answer students' questions in both Arabic and English
Positive character, trusted by the students, creating emotional ties in the group
Existing tech network and experience in technical conversations & discussions
Flexibility at their current job to take this challenge part-time as an external contractor.


Responsibilities

Provide technical support for students daily over an online community forum
Conduct online webinars
Answer questions around course content over the forum and facilitate content for students who get stuck in learning
Participate in organizing community activities in coordination with the forum’s admin to ensure a fun and engaging learning environment and to help in improving students’ progress (such as online webinars, technical quizzes, technical challenges..etc)
Share interesting extracurricular information over its dedicated categories, such as content-related news articles and useful resources to enrich the personal and professional aspects of the community
Attend regular online meetings/ office hours with Udacity representatives through zoom, the online forum, or other medians if needed.
Be responsive over close groups and discussions with Udacity representatives
Provide students with 1:1 support over the community forum or using other medians if needed
Tutors should check their private tutor’s category on the forum on a daily basis to be up to date with all the latest news from your peer tutors, community moderators, and your Udacity community manager


Why should you apply?

Work remotely as an External Contractor
Earn additional income
Contribute to a vibrant, international student community
Stay updated with the latest in cutting-edge technologies


Learn more about the Tutor Guidelines.

Learn More About Udacity's Values

Students First - Better Together - Entrepreneurial - Data Driven - Candid and Direct - Talent Obsessed

Udacity is committed to creating economic empowerment and a more diverse and equitable world. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition (including genetic information), age, veteran status or military status, denial of pregnancy disability leave or reasonable accommodation.

Udacity's Terms of Use and Privacy Policy

title: Sales Engineer, DBS - Immediate Start
description:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
We are on the lookout for a driven Sales Engineer, DBS to join our vibrant team at Grundfos Holding A/S in Riyadh.

Growing your career as a Full Time Sales Engineer, DBS is a great opportunity to develop productive skills.

If you are strong in presentation, problem-solving and have the right drive for the job, then apply for the position of Sales Engineer, DBS at Grundfos Holding A/S today!

Purpose of the Job

Grundfos is seeking a Sales Engineer to join our Domestic Building Services team in Riyadh. The Sales Engineer will manage, build and develop a number of key accounts in the domestic building services group.
This role will report to our Senior Area Sales Manager, DBS Middle East & Africa. Relocation for this position cannot be supported and qualified candidates should be a Saudi National who registered in Saudi Council of Engineer (SCE).

Key Responsibilities

Develop a designated customer base including preparation plans, budgets and promotional activities.
Identify and develop new business with the potential to use Grundfos products and services.
Identify and implement value-added services and enhance customer relationship.
Develop and maintain a strong project pipeline.
Gather market data and provide input on competititor activities. - Register all activities with customers in the global CRM tool
Register and nurture opportunities in the global CRM tool according to company guidelines
Ensure customer master data is updated on portfolio of customers under their responsibility

Job Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering with 2-5 years of project sales experience in mechanical equipments.
Solid knowledge of the plans, processes and activities within the functional area in domestic Building Services.
Experience driving developed processes within domestic Building Services.
Ability to lead processes or projects.
Ability to lead a business process within domestic Building Services
Strong ability influence others.
Possess a great understanding of the relevant systems, local laws and regulations where applicable, for the domestic Building Services.

Additional Information

This role will be based in Al Malaz, Riyadh. If this sounds appealing to you, please upload your CV/resume and cover letter today via our Careers portal. We look forward to hearing from you.

If you want to dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, please visit our Grundfos YouTube Channel here: http://www.youtube.com/grundfos or on

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GrundfosEngineering

To all recruitment agencies

Grundfos does not accept unsolicited agency resumes/CVs. Please do not forward resumes/CVs to our SuccessFactors, our careers email addresses, Grundfos employees or any other company location. Grundfos is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/CVs.

About Grundfos

Grundfos is one of the world’s leading water technology companies with more than 19.000 employees in 60+ countries all over the world. Our skills commit us to pioneering solutions to the world’s water and climate challenges and improve the quality of life for people. We dare to do things that others cannot or dare not do, as we believe innovation is not only a business opportunity, but an obligation. And what really matters to us is not short term profit, but the impact we make. By becoming part of our united powerful team, you too can drive this change no matter your role.

An inclusive team

If you like the look of this job and know you can bring your skills to contribute to our purpose, please apply. We need and welcome professional people from all corners – however you identify and whatever your background is.

Company Benefits

Learning opportunities
Advancement opportunities
Attractive package

Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

title: Analytics Development Engineer
description:
Be part of the Digital Transformation projects working with our Enterprise Data Management Team helping customers by understanding their objectives and resolving real-world challenges to help optimize processes, reduce costs and improve performance through Data-Driven techniques
The individual will help solve various use cases through real-time analytics on large process data sets including data ingestion & onboarding strategy, integration from multiple sources, data cleansing, validation, modeling, transformation, and visualizing results in Analytic & Intelligence Tools
The role includes performing customer requirement analysis, suggesting dashboard UI/UX, developing test cases and system testing, supporting demonstrations and presentations by showing the value add of data-driven software
The individual is expected to grow quickly within the group and contribute to business intelligence and analytics projects.


Requirements:


Data Enthusiast with reasonable experience in one or more of Self-services, Process Data Analytics, Integration, Data Warehousing, Data Mining, or any associated Analytics domain
Professional qualification in either field of Computer Science/ Data Sciences/ Process / Electrical Engineering with working experience in Advanced Analytics and Data Science domain for at least 3+ years
Understands Asset Hierarchies and Structured data sets, Relational Databases
Strong experience in using ETL Techniques and experience with Data Warehouses such as Hadoop/Redshift/Azure Data Factory/BigQuery/ etc
Preferred experience with Data Mining and Advanced Analytics tools using ML techniques like Alteryx/Rapidminer/Dataiku/Microstrategy/Orange
Experience with BI tools such as PowerBI/Tableau/QlikView
Know-how of techniques and methodologies to integrate disparate data sources in a common platform for context-based analytics
Reasonable programming experience with databases and languages (Python/Postgres/SQL/TSQL/PL/JSP/JSP)
Preferable to have experience using Industrial Analytics Tools (OSIsoft/Aspen InfoPlus/Honeywell PHD/GE Proficy/Predix/FactoryTalk) which will be a plus.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills with an aptitude for self-learning and development independently.
Ability to translate customer issues into an implementable use case using various available tools
Preferred to have prior direct/indirect experience with any relevant Industry (Petrochem/Fertilizer/Oil&Energy/Power/Utilities)
Demonstration of the capability to work in multi-disciplinary and multi-ethnic teams
Quick learner and self-starter, who enjoys solving real business challenges with an aptitude for learning the latest technologies and software in the Industrial IoT Domain
Experience with Software Application development is a plus
Interest and exposure to the latest technologies like AI/ML/Data Sciences/IoT/Blockchain etc.

title: QA Analyst - Fully Remote
description:
SMG (Service Management Group) is looking for a Quality Analyst!




Are you looking for the next professional opportunity that will challenge you and advance your career? Join our team now!

SMG helps organizations generate new revenue, grow existing revenue, reduce churn and detractors, and drive operational efficiencies. Our unique software with a service (SwaS) model puts a dual focus on platform technology and professional services, making it easy for brands to activate insights based on customer, patient, and employee feedback.




As a Quality Analyst at SMG, this is what you will do:




Write test plans and test cases in compliance with relevant organizational and industry standards.
Create clearly documented defect reports that enable a developer to recreate the bug.
Articulate process improvement suggestions.
Maintain and update test documentation, user guides, release notes, and help notes to ensure accuracy of applications and related documentation.
Construct complete/thorough manual test cases based on test design and thorough knowledge of the product and its environment.
Consistently ensure high quality, thorough manual test cases that fully exercise product functionality, but consume minimal resources.
Effectively use test automation where appropriate and available to increase the thoroughness of testing.
Execute end-to-end functional tests and utilize automated tests to exercise system.
Collaborate to achieve end-to-end product and process quality.
Understand the business needs our product is trying to meet and applies this understanding to guide testing.
Apply a comprehensive understanding of the product functions and the marketplace in which it is sold effectively test assigned products.
Use knowledge of SQL and data models to validate data at rest.
Create work plans for own deliverables.
Perform other related duties as assigned.




You are a perfect match for the role if you have:




Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science or related area, or the equivalent through a combination of education and work experience.
2-4 years of professional experience in a software QA role.
Experience with testing web applications, relational database knowledge, and ad-hoc testing.
Strong understanding of traditional QA theory and techniques.
Track record of successful process improvements is required.
Understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and Agile software development methods.
Ability to write complex SQL queries.
Experience with writing and executing automated tests
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate with team members.
Passion in pursuit of industry knowledge and best practices are a must.
Ability to read and understand high level code (i.e. C# and Javascript)
Experience using commercial automated testing tools.
Experience with API level testing and data integration testing.




What we offer to our talent:




This is a remote full-time position. You can work from anywhere that allows a minimum of four hours of business working hours overlap with US Central time zone.
Competitive compensation package and ample opportunities to learn and grow.
Diverse, experienced, and friendly team which will welcome you, support you and challenge you.
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and create an inclusive work environment in which all our colleagues experience belonging, have their unique needs respected and met, have equal access to opportunities and resources, and feel fully engaged to contribute to the company’s success.

title: Field Service Engineer Low Current System
description:
Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges

Summer Trainee Job Description

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.

That means changing the way we fly, fuelling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.

Completing your internship at Honeywell will mean that you learn from industry leaders in the field you are passionate about. Our summer trainees often return to complete our graduate program and then go on to become leaders themselves.

All our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries so take the first step today and apply for one of our world-class summer internships.

Where Do You Fit In?

We are currently seeking motivated and passionate individuals to join our Summer Internship Program for 8-10 weeks from 1st June 2022.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to build your experience in Building Management System BMS control systems - CCTV access control and fire alarms.

You will receive industry leading training and support from Honeywell employees and leaders within the Honeywell Building Technologies (HBT) business of Honeywell in Saudi Arabia.

Our Summer Trainees go on to become our next #futureshapers with exciting career paths as Engineers, Project Managers, Directors and future Business Leaders.

Where will our internship program take you?

What Will You Be Doing Every Single Day?

Support the development of on-site installation, service and repair processes of low current systems.
Provide technical presentations to an audience of customers, consultants, and other industry peers.
Daily maintenance activity - actions, to sell or increase the selling domain for Honeywell products
Our interns work 4 hours a day, Sunday to Thursday, with the opportunity for longer hours if preferred

What Skills and Experience Will You Have?

Currently studying for a Bachelors’ Degree in Electrical Engineering - Electronics Engineering
Fluent communication in English and Arabic
Demonstrate a passion in the field solutions Building Management System BMS control systems CCTV access control and fire alarms.
Saudi national

EMEAUR

Additional Information

JOB ID: HRD142762
Category: Customer Experience
Location: 3rd Floor, Olaya Tower A,Riyadh,AL RIYADH,Saudi Arabia
Nonexempt
Engineering (EMEA)

title: Implementation Consultant
description:
About Makeen Advisors




Makeen Advisors is a MENA focused network of independent management consultants, investment professionals, and practitioners with proven experience at leading management consulting firms and blue-chip organizations.




Founded and operated by experienced entrepreneurs and former consultants at the Middle East Offices of McKinsey & Company, Makeen Advisors provides organizations with efficient, flexible and cost-effective ways to access top management consulting and investment professionals as well as expert practitioners to design strategies, implement projects, and run critical initiatives. Our network members have wide-ranging experience across most sectors, functions, and geographies.




We are looking for implementation consultants to join our network.




Role Description:




Implementation Consultants work with Makeen clients to support initiating and delivering strategic projects and initiatives. They are embedded within client teams and take on project and operational responsibilities to deliver change and make things happen. They also work with clients to identify and resolve emerging issues through structured problem-solving.




Duties and Responsibilities:




Articulating project objectives and scope of work in a project charter
Suggesting the structure, tools, and reporting frequency on the initiatives
Managing implementation activities, including time, budget, and risk
Tracking and actioning assigned tasks
Identifying and escalating issues
Managing stakeholders
Developing presentations and reports in a regular manner
Attending relevant meetings, documenting next steps, and actioning them
Drafting letters and correspondences
Performing quality checks
Supporting in research and data collection




Requirements and Qualifications:




Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience)
Project management and/or PMO experience
Consulting experience
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Written and verbal communication skills




Due to the large number of applications we receive, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Aircraft Shift Lead (Saudi Arabia)
description:
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Northrop Grumman Defense Systems is seeking an Aircraft Maintenance Shift Lead at our Saudi Arabia location. The candidate will be responsible for the following:

Troubleshoots, repairs and services aircraft and engine systems. Conducts diagnosis of malfunctions.
Performs maintenance, disassembly, rework, repair, replacement, re-assembly or adjustment of various aircraft systems in accordance with technical specifications, engineering instructions, and FAA regulations.
Maintains FAA required records, manuals and inspection forms.
Responsible for the management and execution of all maintenance on assigned USAF E-11A aircraft.
Execute line-maintenance/flight operations support for multiple USAF E-11A overseas deployed aircraft including all electrical and mechanical troubleshooting, fault isolation and repair, parts replacement, line repairable unit (LRU) replacement, calibration tasks, testing, engine repairs and/or replacements and proper documentation in aircraft forms (Air Force Form 781 series).
Conduct maintenance of aircraft in line with USAF ground maintenance procedures and in compliance with associated Airworthiness approvals.
Conduct Tier 2 maintenance (in depth maintenance, repairs, etc.) and Tier 3 maintenance (modifications and depot level or major maintenance) at operational OCONUS site(s).
Conduct progressive maintenance and inspections on aircraft at remote OCONUS locations to minimize aircraft downtime for longer term maintenance requirements.
Service aircraft, perform end-of-runway, postflight, preflight, thru-flight, and phase inspections.
Advise on problems maintaining, servicing, and inspecting aircraft and related aerospace equipment.
Use technical data to diagnose and solve maintenance problems on aircraft systems.
Interpret and advise on maintenance procedures and policies to repair aircraft and related equipment.
Troubleshoot and maintain aircraft structures, systems, components, and related equipment.
Remove and install aircraft components conducting functional tests of repaired components and systems.
Adjust, align and rig aircraft systems.
Supervise and perform aircraft jacking, lifting and towing operations.
Inspect aircraft structures, systems, components and related systems.
Supervise and perform aircraft and component inspections.
Interpret inspection findings and determines adequacy of corrective actions.
Inspect and check components for clearances, tolerances, proper installation and operation.
Inspect and operate powered and non-powered aerospace ground equipment.
Inspect and identify aircraft corrosion for prevention and repair.
Review maintenance forms, aircraft records, automated maintenance data systems and historical reports to ensure complete documentation.
Inventory and maintain aircraft equipment.
Accomplish maintenance and troubleshooting of ground support equipment.
Assist other aircraft leads and functional team members with any associated aircraft maintenance actions and other duties as assigned by the Site Maintenance Manager as necessary to ensure mission success.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree with 5 years' experience OR High School diploma with 9 years' experience.
Current Airframe and Powerplant Certificate.
Current US Passport.
Must have ability to obtain and maintain a DoD SECRET Security Clearance.
Ability to obtain a Citibank corporate MasterCard credit card.
Ability to pass a pre-deployment physical and then once hired, a yearly physical.
Applicants must meet medical requirements for worldwide travel, which include a physical.

Preferred Qualifications

10 or more years BD-700 Global Express or USAF E-11A aircraft experience.
Current DoD SECRET Clearance with at least one year from expiring.
Business or Regional Jet experience a plus (CRJ, G-5, G-4, Challenger, Falcon, etc.).
5+ years Aircraft Maintenance operations experience in business and/or airline aircraft industry.
2 years' experience as deployed E-11A mechanic.
Special Mission aircraft experience.
DoD/civilian maintenance program experience.
Corridor and CAMP Aviation Maintenance Program software experience.
Civilian/military Customer Response Center/Cell experience.
Previous experience in FAR Part 135/145 or MRO environment preferred.
Proficient in computer operations and Microsoft Office Software (Outlook, Word, Excel, and Access).

Salary Range: $76,200 USD - $114,400 USD

The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

title: Part-Time Python Instructor
description:
Who are we?

Since 2011, General Assembly has transformed tens of thousands of careers through pioneering, experiential education in today’s most in-demand skills. As featured in The Economist, Wired, and The New York Times, GA offers training in web development, data, design, business, and more, both online and at campuses around the world. Our global professional community boasts 40,000 alumni — and counting.

In addition to fostering career growth for individuals, GA helps employers cultivate top tech talent and spur innovation by transforming their teams through strategic learning. More than 21,000 employees at elite companies worldwide have honed their digital fluency with our corporate training programs. GA has also been recognized as one of Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500, and Fast Company has dubbed us leaders in World-Changing Ideas and the #1 Most Innovative Company in Education.

In this 5 day accelerated course, students will learn programming fundamentals and Python basics. Through hands on exercises, students will build Python programs that increase in complexity throughout the course. We are looking for an instructor to lead this part-time Python Programming course (see course page ). Though we provide a core curriculum along with instructor resources, you will have the opportunity to implement your ideas by adapting our materials as one of the course’s first instructors.

Skills And Qualifications

You have strong experience using the following tools: Python, Pandas, or other frameworks & libraries
You are eager to shape the skills, minds, and trajectories of eager General Assembly students.
You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are trying to figure something out.
You have at least 5 years of work experience in a role where you’ve used Python.
You are active in the Python community.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

Teach 8 classroom hours for 1 week
Instructors will need to commit a few hours per week preparing lessons and materials, leveraging existing GA curriculum content.
Work alongside GA staff and teaching team to best meet the needs and learning styles of your students.
Guide students through development of a stellar final project that will showcase their abilities to hiring managers.
Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community.
Inspire students to persevere through the challenges of learning a new suite of skills

title: IT Support Technician , Ops Tech IT
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

At Amazon, we strive to be earth’s most customer-centric company where people can find and discover anything they want to buy online. We hire the world’s brightest minds, offering them an environment in which they can relentlessly improve the experience for customers. Innovation and creativity are built into the DNA of the company and are encouraged at all levels of employment. Every day we solve complex technical and business problems with ingenuity and simplicity. We are making history and the good news is we have only just begun.

This is your chance to make history.

As an IT Technician, you will report to the IT Manager at your home site and will be responsible for working closely with the business, your colleagues and remote support teams to implement and maintain infrastructure elements. You will represent the ‘face of IT’ to the Business and you will thrive in providing world-class service to our customers.

You will be a key part of a multinational diverse team, thrive in delivering high-quality results and always be on the lookout for improvements.

Business Area: Operations – Fulfilment Centre and Logistics

The IT Operation team supports the IT Infrastructure at each of the Amazon sites and provides IT support to our customer base.

What makes this team a great place to work?

Day 1 opportunity – You will be joining a team that is responsible to what happens after the customer clicks “buy”.
Opportunities for growth - You will have the opportunity to influence and shape the direction of our services.
You will be part of exciting projects with the opportunity to focus and develop expertise in areas of your interest.

What We Are Looking For

Putting the customers first, you will provide a 1st support service that ensures all IT equipment and infrastructure is running to its optimum performance and that all departmental Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are met on your home site as well as any remote sites that you and your team also support.

The extent of your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

Health & Safety: ownership and accountability, ensuring that work is carried out to a high standard and complies with all Amazon polices and guidelines.
Installation, maintenance and support of IT equipment
Asset and Inventory management.
Liase with 3rd party vendors and suppliers to ensure efficient asset management.
Liaise with contractors or external suppliers and clearly communicate technical issues and Amazon standards.
Maximizing the availability of all IT equipment and infrastructure through continuous improvement and proactive, preventative maintenance.
Providing technical support/input to site and team projects and initiatives.
Conducting end user equipment trials and testing.
Providing assistance to senior engineers as required

Working in shifts and support occasional changes in working hours.


Basic Qualifications

What will you bring: / Basic Qualifications:

Experience in Microsoft Operating Systems and Applications, basic networking troubleshooting skills.
Experience with computers (both hardware and software)
Customer service with demonstrable history/examples.
Be self-motivated and able to work alone as well as part of a team.
Ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment, with minimal guidance.


Preferred Qualifications

Your background would ideally have: / Preferred Qualifications:

Two years of technical (IT) exposure in an operational environment.
Previous experience in a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on customer service.
Ability to develop clear, concise documentation.
Desire to train others and be generous with time to pass on knowledge.
Ability to work with cross-functional teams.
Ability to execute technical tasks.
Desire to improve existing processes and procedures coupled with the ability to deliver first class service.

Please note you are not required to meet all of the above-mentioned expectations, any combination is welcome!

In addition, we expect fluency in English (Common European Framework of Reference C2), open mind, willingness to learn new skills and to be a great team player.

Valid driving licence and flexibility to work and travel outside of your designated location.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.


Company - Afaq Q Tech General Trading

Job ID: A1921061

title: Manager- Nature and Environmental Data, Reporting & Analytics
description:
Position: Manager- Nature and Environment Data, Reporting & Analytics

Reports to: Director of Delivery & Innovation Director

Sector: NEOM Authority - Nature

Job Location: Sharma, KSA

Role Purpose:

To organize, manage, and analyze spatial data and modelling associated with conservation projects and development projects across NEOM.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & ACTIVITIES :

Manage spatial data related to biodiversity, ecosystems, human activity, development, and conservation projects for NEOM
Conduct spatial analysis and modelling using GIS platforms Arc and QGIS
Prepare maps and other spatial products for conservation and management purposes
Be the point of contact for Nature Reserve Region spatial data
Review new spatial data technologies for use by Nature Reserve Region
Development and design of database strategies, monitoring and improving database performance and capacity, and planning for future expansion requirements.
Lead, support, design, and create powerful reports, dashboards, or analysis using a variety of tools to help support fact-based decision making.
Support and help manage internal data processes where needed
Define and deliver of data governance approaches, principles and processes
Develop approach and application of data quality principles, methods and processes to improve the quality of data
Define, embed and drive master data management approaches, principles and processes
Researching and creating effective methods to collect data, analyzing information, and recommending solutions to a business


BACKGROUND, SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

Knowledge, Skills and Experience:

Experience with project management
Experience with QGIS and Arc GIS platforms
Experienced working with remote sensing data
Experience with GPS and other field-based tools for geolocation
Familiarity with data ownership, sharing issues and protocols
Strong leadership skills and proven ability to simultaneously manage a wide number of different projects and tasks
A creative and agile approach to workplace challenges, able to adapt and find solutions to rapidly changing conditions and challenges
A willingness and ability to conduct field work in Arabian desert, savanna, and montane arid environments for extended periods of time


Qualifications And Experience.

Degree in relevant field such as spatial data analysis, conservation planning, natural resource management

Skilled in QGIS, Arc, remote sensing tools, GPS and other field geospatial tools

Benefits

Free Accommodation.
Free Laundry and housekeeping.
Free transportation.
2 flights per month domestic round trip.
1 Annual Travel Allowance.
Relocation Flight.
Free Meals ( breakfast, lunch, dinner ).

Remote Working 24 working days annual.

title: Legal & Contracts Intern
description:
Raytheon Technologies is looking for an intern to join our Contracts team at Riyadh office beginning summer 2022 for up to 7 months. The Intern will be involved in a wide variety of business setting engagements that will involve working closely with our functional partners and leadership. This position will need a candidate with a strong desire to learn real world legal, contracts, and compliance applications in the defense industry to complement their academic experience. The legal & contracts departments operates in a fast paced, dynamic environment in which new innovative, leading edge approaches to problem solving are highly encouraged. This position requires an understanding of or desire to further develop principles, concepts, and practices affecting to the various fields of business. The ideal candidate will be working in a team environment, having not only academic, but also interpersonal skills to help optimize the output of our team.

Your Responsibilities

The role is created for Legal studies students either with one year to complete LL.B, recent graduate, within or have completed the 3-year in-field experience period, with an interest in gaining experience in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment for the duration of the internship. The responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Supporting Legal Team in accomplishing general counsel responsibilities, including but not limited to preparing and reviewing legal, contracts, and compliance and related activities such as:
Provide data analytics support and assist with data analytic tools/process improvements
Engage with relevant functional groups to help drive RTX compliance across the business
Brainstorm with the team and others to identify new areas for improvement
Supporting Contracts Team in development and preparation of Contracts Actions, review of contracts and other general contracts administration activities such as:
Prepare documentation to support teams and create, update, and monitors the timeliness of contract actions
Cataloguing documents for archiving purposes.
Assist with writing and formatting Contracts documents and presentations
Coordinating with other functions as required performing contract activities.
Learning and using Contracts shared drives and databases to enter and retrieve critical information and provide data management support.
Conducting research on unique topics (i.e. Government Tenders and Procurement Law, RTX Terms & Conditions).

Basic Qualifications And Requirements

The successful candidate for this position will possess the following:

Currently enrolled in final year or graduate of undergraduate degree program Law (LL.B).
Student GPA should be (3+ out of 4) or (4+ out of 5).
An official university letter is required to be attached along with the CV.
Excellent collaboration skills and ability to work across culturally diverse organizations and geographically dispersed teams.
Proficient in Arabic and English (both written and oral); must be able to communicate effectively with all levels of management via email, telephone, and in person.

Desired Skills

Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and work independently when required.
Solid organizational skills.
Ability to exercise independent judgment and manage complexity in a multiculturally diverse environment.
Experience working in a team to quickly address challenges.

title: Manager.Fabrication.II
description:
Job Description

title: Technician.Installation and Commissioning.II
description:
Job Description

Duties & Responsibilities:

Must ensure that company policies and procedures are being enforced and adhered to

at all times.

Interprets specifications, blueprints, and job orders to workers and assigns duties.
Uses hoisting equipment and forklifts for raising and lowering structural members and

other heavy loads.

Rigs up heavy loads for rising or lowering; using chains, cables, and ropes.
Signals worker operating hoisting equipment to lift and place loads.
Pulls, pushes, and pries steel members into approximate position while members are

supported by lifting device.

Forces members into final position, using crowbars, jacks, and hand tools.
Aligns holes in member with corresponding holes in previously placed member and

secu r e s with larg e stee l pins.

Verifies vertical and horizontal alignment using levels and plumb bobs.
Sets up tanks related equipment to exact measurements for testing purposes.
Hook up all piping to all tanks and pumps for testing purposes.
Install mechanical and hydraulic components to specification
Inspect and evaluate mechanical installations for conformance to written specifications.
Document deficiencies in assemblies using the appropriate checklist.
Communicate functional problems with equipment to supervising staff.
Troubleshoot and repair hydraulic circuits and components.
Verify purchased components match required specifications.
Perform other work related tasks as assigned.
Comply with all NOV Company and HSE procedures and policies.

Strategic

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

Written and spoken English communication skills
Ability to read mechanical drawings and hydraulic schematics
Ability to use and familiarity with stauff test kits and hydraulic test equipment.
Excellent safety working record is required.
Must be able to work as a team member and take decisions when necessary.

title: Waitress
description:
At Four Seasons, we believe in recognizing a familiar face, welcoming a new one and treating everyone we meet the way we would want to be treated ourselves. Whether you work with us, stay with us, live with us or discover with us, we believe our purpose is to create impressions that will stay with you for a lifetime. It comes from our belief that life is richer when we truly connect to the people and the world around us. Our company values are much more than a program or a policy; they define who we are and inform the decisions we make. The company's guiding principle is the Golden Rule, and as such Four Seasons strives to have a long-lasting, positive influence on the communities where we operate and on the people we employ and serve around the world.

“The reason for our success is no secret. It comes down to one single principle that transcends time, geography, and culture. It’s the Golden Rule – the simple idea that if you treat people well, the way you would like to be treated, they will do the same.” – Isadore Sharp, Founder and Chairman Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts.

Career Opportunity

The deeply instilled Four Seasons culture is personified by its employees, people who share a single focus and are inspired to provide exceptional service. Be part of a cohesive team with opportunities to build a successful career with global potential.

Waitress / Waiter

Four Seasons Hotel Riyadh at Kingdom Centre is looking for individuals who are holding Saudi's nationality.

The Waitress / Waiter is an essential member of the Food & Beverage team dedicated to providing exceptional quality and service to our guests. The Waitress / Waiter position assists the Captain in providing an enjoyable expertly served dining experience conforming to Four Seasons standards of excellence for quality, professionalism and friendliness. Bussers clear tables and reset them neatly, rapidly and completely according to specification.

We are looking for an individual who possesses an affinity for service! This position requires an applicant with general food knowledge. Candidates must have good personal presentation and interpersonal skills. The ability to perform this position to Four Seasons Standards is required. In addition to discreetly clearing tables, the Waitress / Waiter performs side work, polishes silverware, and refills condiment containers and crumbs tables. The applicants must have a flexible schedule with the ability to work all shifts, weekends and holidays. The ideal candidate will have an outgoing personality and a can-do approach to any task!

The Benefits Offered By Four Seasons Hotel Riyadh

Full board shared living accommodation in a high quality, well-resourced accommodation
21 days vacation
9 days Public Holidays per year
Paid home leave tickets
Quality of employee meals
Regular social and sporting events
Free transportation to work.
Laundry/dry cleaning for provided uniforms
Full medical coverage

We look forward to receiving your application!

Learn more about what it is like to work at Four Seasons, visit us:

http://jobs.fourseasons.com/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/four-seasons-hotels-and-resorts

https://www.facebook.com/FourSeasonsJobs

https://twitter.com/FourSeasonsJobs

title: Fleet and Roadside Assistance Manager, Middle East.
description:
Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility

At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.

We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

Role

Develop and implement a strategic operations plan to grow and manage our vehicle fleet and related assets
Coordinate the maintenance, licensing, regulatory vehicle compliance and vehicle health with operation teams
Create and spearhead the management of our service fleet with vehicle purchase forecasts, timelines, and milestones
Collaborate with technical teams to create vehicle specifications as needed for vendors
Identify potential suppliers, maintain business partnerships and contracts for vehicle procurement, remarketing, and other opportunities to improve residual value of fleet
Routinely monitor payment for delivered fleet, lease company, and commercial account vehicles and support resolution as needed
Evaluate and implement asset tracking and telematics software to help monitor driver safety and ensure compliance protocols are achieved
Develop and implement operational procedures for fleet management, including DOT compliant verification, accident and citation reporting, asset inspections, etc.
Identify opportunities to streamline vehicle maintenance and operations to reduce costs and capital expenditures
Support driver training programs and ensure safe and compliant operations
Manage replacement (rental) vehicle and rideshare program and business partners
Coordinate Lucid Service’s loaner fleet program to increase internal efficiencies and customer experience.
Develop and organize strategic business initiatives for Lucid Motor’s Roadside Vendor to deliver a premium roadside assistance experience. Identify tools, resources, and training for continuous improvement
Become subject matter expert on Lucid Motors vehicles, Roadside Vendor systems, and Roadside Assistance service offerings and processes. Ensure Roadside interactions can take place seamlessly 24/7, 365
Serve as a single point of contact for all Partner Roadside Vendor communications, for the day-to-day management of the program as well as program or procedural changes
Ensure potentially critical incidents are identified, understood, and escalated to leadership. Expeditiously address and resolve any service provider issues, damage claims, or incidents
Evaluate metrics and processes to understand operational performance. Extrapolate data to ensure proactive solutions and accurate reporting
Identify and recommend steps to remediate any emerging issues. Provide proactive communication to appropriate team members and managers regarding trends
Understand support function policies and procedures to oversee roadside, ensuring network optimization, and KPI’s are achieved, as well as cost control. Facilitate preparation and execution of regular business reviews with vendors.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in business or equivalent experience
5+ years in roadside, automotive customer call center management, industry experience managing operations for fleet.
Must be able to expertly document, track, and report on program status, and deliver updates with exceptional business acumen
Experience implementing and utilizing project management software and asset tracking tools.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and prioritization capabilities?
Ability to work autonomously under aggressive timelines and on budget.
Strong written and oral skills and the ability to drive cross-functional communication.
Expert communication and organization, as well as relationship-building skills

Advantageous

Experience managing multiple projects across varying geographic locations
EV and startup experience

At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

Notice regarding COVID-19 protocols

At Lucid, we prioritize the health and wellbeing of our employees, families, and friends above all else. In response to the novel Coronavirus all new Lucid employees, whose job will be based in the United States may or may not be required to provide original documentation confirming status as having received the prescribed inoculation (doses). Vaccination requirements are dependent upon location and position, please refer to the job description for more details.

Individuals in positions requiring vaccinations may seek a medical and/or religious exemption from this requirement and may be granted such an accommodation after submitting a formal request to and the subsequent review and approval thereof by our dedicated Covid-19 Response team.

To all recruitment agencies : Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

description:

title: Mechanical Engineering Intern
description:
Company Overview

At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, you have the opportunity to try new things and make a bigger difference across a broader end-to-end solution, a richer technology and product set, an expanded range of disciplines, a growing global footprint and a more diverse team of colleagues and customers. Visit us at https://www.rtx.com

Role Summary

Raytheon Technologies is looking for a Coop Student to join our DMR Technical team at Jeddah office for up to 7 months. The Intern will be involved in a wide variety of engagements that will work closely with our function partners and leadership. This position will provide Deep Maintenance (DM) support to the DMR team. Assist in the assembly, disassembly, re-assembly, repair and/or inspection of electronic, electrical, and mechanical systems, chassis and printed circuit boards. This individual will observes, analyzes and reports test data, and when appropriate makes necessary repairs to equipment

Your Responsibilities

The role is created for Mechanical Engineering studies students with an interest in gaining experience in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment for a short period of time. Each student will be expected to use their own initiative and undertake self-directed learning within a supportive environment to work with the team to develop goals and objectives to further common areas of interest. The responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Participates in preventive maintenance measures on all the Electro Mechanical Equipment.
Perform electro-mechanical assembly and inspection
Demonstrated ability to remove and replace failed assemblies and subassemblies.
Collaborate with team for modification, repair, test and checkout of the equipment.
Participates in heavy equipment maintenance and repair of the following:
Brakes components and air lines
Suspension components and assemblies
hydraulic component and assemblies
Participates in cable and interconnects removal and repair


Basic Qualifications And Requirements

The successful candidate for this position will possess the following:

Currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree program with an emphasis in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
Student GPA should be (3+ out of 4) or (4+ out of 5).
An official university letter is required to be attached along with the CV.
Excellent collaboration skills and ability to work across diverse organizations and teams.
Proficient in Arabic and English (both written and oral); must be able to communicate effectively with all levels of management via email, telephone, and in person.


Desired Skills

Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and work independently.
Solid organizational skills.
Ability to exercise independent judgment and manage complexity in a diverse environment.
Experience working in a team to quickly address challenges.


This position requires a Saudi Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.

title: NKSA -Tax Manager
description:
Tax Manager – Nissan KSA

Role:

The Tax Manager role is to manage Tax Operation, Local Tax Compliance, Tax Audits and Litigation for Nissan Saudi Arabia. The scope is to cover all kind of taxes - VAT, Transfer Pricing, Corporate Income tax, withholding tax, payroll tax etc. The role reports functionally to the Regional Tax Manager - ME and administratively to the CFO in KSA.

Key responsibilities:

Management of tax compliance initiatives for all taxes KSA (including income tax, VAT, withholding taxes, stamp tax, payroll tax).
Experience in managing tax litigation - working closely with advisors / counsel and extensive interaction with Saudi Arabia Tax authorities / appeal authorities in managing tax disputes.
Responsibility for maintenance of systems, controls and management reports for VAT and income taxes. Lead and manage implementation of e-Invoicing project for Nissan KSA.
Monthly reporting of tax provision/expense, effective tax rate and cash tax for all three countries to global consolidation team.
Ongoing monitoring of profitability levels in the Middle East and interaction with global transfer pricing team as required.
Support external advisors in preparation of local transfer pricing documentation and defense files for audits.
Key point of contact with tax authorities in case of audit.
Manage relationship and cost of tax advisors.
Manage relationship with tax authorities as well as other government agencies involved in the supervision and payment of tax incentives
Develop capability within accounting teams to provide support in initial preparation of income tax and VAT returns in KSA.
Educate other functions on tax processes and raise awareness for compliance risks
Support and partner with other in-house teams/departments in ad hoc projects.


Qualifications & Experience:

At least 7 years’ experience in Tax and Finance with focus on tax, compliance and transfer pricing.
Certified Accounting or tax professional or similar
Specialist knowledge of taxes and extensive experience in dealing with taxes authorities.

Experience with cross-functional projects

Fluent English and Arabic
Strong analytical skills
Hands-on approach
Open-minded and willing to work in a multi-functional and multi-cultural environment.
Independent to work without local functional supervision
Good communication and presentation skills to explain tax issues to business
Extremely important that communication must be in very clear, concise and plain English


Saudi Arabia

(Intern)
